page.title: 18FOOTPATHS
page.content: Around Bellingham there are many footpaths through unspoilt attractive countryside. The village itself is pleasant to walk around with its old buildings,churches and riverside walks. Leading away from the village is the attractive Hareshaw Lynn already described and of course the Pennine Way passes through Bellingham.This was the first of several long distance walks to be reopened in England leading through wild beautiful rough and remote areas.Many people young and old are seen trudging along with heavily laden packs perhaps ready for a night at the Youyh Hostel on their way to completing the long journey. Out towards Redesmouth paths criss cross the farmland,one going to an old pack horse bridge across the River Rede, a good place to see wildlife.
